primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a world where human nature is irredeemably corrupt and silent, breaking the 'stitched heavens' through the historical incarnation and crucifixion of Christ to save the wicked.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has taken away the judgments against you
He has cast out your enemies
He came into our desert places... to stand under the wrath of God in place of the murderers
The power of God for salvation
The Father Abyss is affectionate to all its creatures
The word of God came unto John
The prophets of Israel begin to speak

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Wicked' (Rwanda murderers, the congregation, the 'brood of vipers')
tekstueel_bewijs: In place of the murderers of Rwanda and us sinners inside these four walls
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver/Sinner, not the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: The cross is the sign that God has not remained silent
Jesus of Nazareth was a historical person
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper (the Cross).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the one enabling the 'vocation to bear witness'.

tekstueel_bewijs: The intractable wickedness of the human heart
The Abomination... the Wrath of God
Midnight to the north... and midnight to the south
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a bad habit but 'irredeemable corruption' and 'ontological silence' that only a 'crucified Messiah' can bridge.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response: bearing witness to the Gospel in the face of intellectual scorn.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witness) is explicitly a 'vocation' that follows the primary program (salvation).

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has taken away the judgments
He has cast out your enemies
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are invited all together to prepare ourselves
I believe in the gospel because...
We are to step forward and be first in line

voorbeelden: We are to step forward and be first in line
Our responsibility... is to bear witness
Who can go on believing after reading this?
The prophets knew exactly what that French priest was talking about
It is the power of God for salvation
He... has won the victory over all our desert places

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God to act where human 'Power' has failed (Rwanda, desert places). Human 'Devoir' is reduced to the response of witness.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the negation of 'Faith in Mankind' (~S1) to the reality of 'Wrath' (S2), then shows Christ entering S2 to bring the hearer to 'Grace' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ stands under the wrath (S2) to transform the 'Father Abyss' into an 'Affectionate Father' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon refuses to bypass the 'Dies Irae'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as 'irredeemable' and makes God the sole agent of rescue through a historical, substitutionary event.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are invited all together to prepare ourselves

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He came... to stand under the wrath of God in place of... us sinners
The wicked swallows up the man more righteous than he

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (John the Baptist, Prophets) are used as heralds or watchmen, not as moral examples to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them as pointers to God's action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'saving the world' or 'self-improvement' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God acts, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'desert places' of the human heart to the historical 'cross' is seamless and logically necessary.
spanning_punten: The tension between intellectual skepticism (Jasper Griffin) and the 'preposterous' claim of a crucified Messiah.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: To stand under the wrath of God in place of the murderers of Rwanda and us sinners

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological endowment of 'Power' rather than the Pneumatological.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity ('destroyed my faith in mankind forever').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's historical action in Christ. The hearer is correctly positioned as the beneficiary of a rescue they cannot perform.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'how' of the secondary program (Savoir-faire of witness).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase emphasis on the Spirit's role in the secondary program.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'vocation to bear witness' to the Spirit's empowerment.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Wrath) is already sufficiently intensified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the trap of 'cheap grace' by taking the 'Opponent' (Wrath/Sin) seriously, while maintaining God as the sole 'Subject' of the rescue.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of poetry (Dickinson/Frost); Greimas shows that these poems function as 'Opponents' or 'Descriptions of Lack' that necessitate the Divine Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain Habakkuk's context; Greimas shows how Habakkuk functions as a 'Sender' of the value of 'Faith' which Paul then re-codes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Rwanda' anecdote isn't just an illustration, but a semiotic 'Destruction of the Human Subject,' forcing the narrative to find a Divine Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'Subject-Check' by ensuring that in every critical soteriological juncture, God is the one acting.
